abstract_summ: Radiologists must be aware of COVID-19 presentations on PET/CT scan images during COVID-19 outbreak.Chest analysis incidentally revealed bilateral diffuse patchy ground-glass opacity with mild increasing (18)F-FDG uptake, consistent with incidental COVID-19 infection finding during the March 2020 pandemic.The nuclear medicine physicians should be prepared to suspect COVID-19 even in asymptomatic patients presenting with a “far-from-COVID-19” finding at PET/CT.We present a highly suspicious case of COVID-19 infection, incidentally found on (18)F-FDG PET/CT images.We present the case of an asymptomatic patient referred for FDG PET/CT imaging of a lung nodule who demonstrated the typical CT findings of COVID-19 infection and was subsequently found to be positive on testing.It led us to improve patient flow and to undertake broader measures to avoid patient clinical issues and potential disease spreading.
title_summ: Lung Scintigraphy Imaging Features in a Young Patient With COVID-19.Incidental COVID-19 Pneumonia on (18)F-Fluorocholine PET/CTIncidental Finding of COVID-19 Lung Infection in (18)F-FDG PET/CT: What Should We Do?Laboratory-Proven Asymptomatic SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) Infection on (18)F-FDG PET/CT(18)F-FDG PET/CT in Hodgkin Lymphoma With Unsuspected COVID-19(18)F-FDG PET/CT and Serial Chest CT Findings in a COVID-19 Patient With Dynamic Clinical Characteristics in Different Period(18)F-FDG PET/CT Metabolic Behavior of COVID-19 Pneumonia: A Series of 4 Patients With RT-PCR ConfirmationPET/CT of COVID-19 as an Organizing PneumoniaAtypical Presentation of COVID-19 Incidentally Detected at (18)F-FDG PET/CT in an Asymptomatic Oncological PatientA Case of Coronavirus Infection Incidentally Found on FDG PET/CT ScanFDG PET/CT in a Patient With Mantle Cell Lymphoma and COVID-19: Typical FindingsPositron Emission Tomography for Detecting COVID-19 in Asymptomatic Left Ventricular Assist Device RecipientsFDG PET/CT Findings in an Asymptomatic Case of Confirmed COVID-19FDG PET/CT in Diagnosing COVID-19 Infection in a Cancer Patient With Exposure History But Minimal SymptomsIncidental Discovery of a COVID-19 Infection on a Reevaluation FDG PET/CT in a Patient Treated for Hodgkin LymphomaCOVID-19: Incidental Diagnosis by (18)F-FDG PET/CT
title_abstract_phrases: Radiologists must be aware of COVID-19 presentations on PET/CT scan images during COVID-19 outbreak.Therefore, nuclear medicine physicians should be prepared to recognize and diagnose incidental COVID-19 pneumonia manifestation on (18)F-fluorocholine PET/CT, due to the crucial epidemiological implications.Chest analysis incidentally revealed bilateral diffuse patchy ground-glass opacity with mild increasing (18)F-FDG uptake, consistent with incidental COVID-19 infection finding during the March 2020 pandemic.This case highlights the procedure and findings of V/Q scanning (without embolism) in COVID-19.Incidental COVID-19 Pneumonia on (18)F-Fluorocholine PET/CTWe present the case of a patient who underwent (18)F-fluorocholine PET/CT for biochemical recurrence of prostate cancer in which bilateral pneumonia was diagnosed.We present the case of an asymptomatic patient referred for FDG PET/CT imaging of a lung nodule who demonstrated the typical CT findings of COVID-19 infection and was subsequently found to be positive on testing.
